Choose a programming language for additional learning resources

What is HTML?

HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It allows the creation and structure of sections, paragraphs, and links using HTML elements (the building blocks of a web page) such as tags and attributes. 

Learn More

What is CSS?

With CSS, you can control the color, font, the size of text, the spacing between elements, how elements are positioned and laid out, what background images or background colors are to be used, different displays for different devices and screen sizes, and much more!

Learn More

What is JavaScript?

JavaScript is a scripting or programming language that allows you to implement complex features on web pages

Learn More

What is PHP?

PHP is an acronym for "PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor". This language is an open source scripting language that is widely-used in the industry. PHP scripts are executed on the server-side and is free to download and use.

Learn More

What is Python?

Python is a popular programming language. It was created by Guido van Rossum, and released in 1991. This coding language is mainly used for web development, software development, mathematics and system scripting.

Learn More

What is C++

C++ is a cross-platform language developed by Bjarne Stroustrup, as an extension to the C language.This language can be used to create high-performance applications. C++ gives programmers a high level of control over system resources and memory.

Learn More

Audio/Video DOM Reference

The <video> tag is used to embed video content in a document, such as video streams. The <audio> tag is used to embed sound content in a document.

Learn More

How CSS is structured?

An external stylesheet contains CSS in a separate file with a .css extension. This is the most common and useful method of bringing CSS to a document. You can link a single CSS file to multiple web pages, styling all of them with the same CSS stylesheet.

Learn More

Troubleshooting in JavaScript

Generally speaking, when you do something wrong in code, there are two main types of errors that you'll come across: Syntax and Logical.

Learn More

What's new in PHP 7

PHP 7 is much faster than the previous popular stable release (PHP 5.6) and has improved Error Handling. PHP 7 supports stricter Type Declarations for function arguments and new operations like the spaceship operator

Learn More

Python Syntax

Python was designed for readability, and has some similarities to the English language with influence from mathematics. Every new line is a new line of code opposed to other languages that use semicolons or parenthesis to end a line of code.

Learn More

C++ vs. C

C++ was developed as an extension of C, and both languages have almost the same syntax. The main difference between C and C++ is that C++ supports classes and objects, while C does not.

Learn More
